div.p: SOLO in the Italian muſic, is frequently uſed in pieces conſiſting of ſeveral parts, to mark thoſe that are to perform alone ; as fiauto s olο, violino solo. It is alſo uſed ſor ſonatas compoſed for one violin, one German flute, or other inſtrument, and a baſs ; thus we say, Corelli's ſolos, Geminiani's solοs, & c. When two or three parts play or ſing ſeparately from the grand chorus, they are called a doi soli, a tre soli, & c. Solo is ſometimes denoted bv S.
